title: HOW TO make a Gravity Fed Water Supply | What You Need.

tasks.task: Convert a jerry can into a gravity-fed system for camping.
subtasks: Unplug the water outlet at the bottom of the jerry can.
Attach a 20mm BPA thread to the jerry can's outlet.
Apply Teflon tape to the thread for a secure connection.
Screw the thread into the jerry can and ensure it's not over-tightened.
Install a garden hose with a brass fitting, ensuring it's crimped tight.
Connect an inline tap with a 13mm thread to the hose fitting.
Measure and cut the hose to desired length.
Attach a hose clamp to secure the hose onto the jerry can.
Test the setup for leaks by filling with water and checking for issues.
Adjust the height of the jerry can to ensure proper gravity-fed flow.

tasks.task: Demonstrate the setup process for a gravity-fed jerry can system.
subtasks: Disassemble the setup for visual clarity.
Highlight modifications made to the jerry can and hose system.
Reinforce the cost-effectiveness of the setup compared to purchasing additional water.
Address considerations for drinking water versus other uses.
